ko: 언덕에 자리 잡고 있어서 호텔에서 보는 만의 전경이 아주 좋아요.

en: Look at that tower standing on the hill.
ko: 언덕 위에 서 있는 저 타워 좀 봐요.

en: Look at that building standing on the hill.
ko: 언덕 위에 있는 저 건물 좀 보세요.

en: There stands a beautiful church on the hill.
ko: 언덕 위에 아름다운 교회가 하나 있어요.

en: The house which stands on the hill is very old.
ko: 언덕 위에 있는 집은 아주 오래됐어요.

en: Are there oak trees on the hill?
There is a large house on the hill.
ko: 언덕 위에 큰 집이 하나 있어요.

en: There is a house on the hill.
ko: 언덕 위에 집이 한 채 있어요.

en: His house was in sight from the top of the hill.
ko: 언덕 꼭대기에서 그 사람 집이 보였어요.

en: From the hill, we could see all the buildings in the city.
Lots of campers were parked all over the hill-side.
ko: 언덕 곳곳에 캠핑카들이 많이 주차되어 있었어요.

en: A beautiful valley lies behind the hill.
We came in sight of the hill.
At the foot of the hill is a beautiful lake.
Lots of low trees grow on the hill.
We can get a beautiful view of the sea from the hill.
My neck snapped when I did a headstand.
ko: 물구나무서기 하다가 목에서 뚝 소리가 났어요.

en: Paradoxically, he is right.
She carries on smiling even in the face of adversity.
ko: 그녀는 역경 속에서도 계속 미소를 잃지 않아요.

en: Despite adversity, the ingenious man achieved worldwide fame.
ko: 역경에도 불구하고 그 독창적인 남자는 세계적인 명성을 얻었어요.

en: Despite adversity, the architect achieved worldwide fame.
ko: 역경에도 불구하고 그 건축가는 세계적인 명성을 얻었어요.

en: Adversity is the best school.
The converse is also true.
Please turn over.
The footnotes are at the bottom of the page.
Footnotes are notes at the foot of a page.
Throw away the chairs whose legs are broken.
I'll be about again when my leg heals.
ko: 다리 다 나으면 다시 돌아다닐 거야.

en: The guests wished the happy couple a long and prosperous life.
ko: 하객들은 그 행복한 커플이 오래오래 잘 살기를 빌어줬어.

en: A flight attendant walks up to the boys.
From an objective viewpoint, his argument was far from rational.
ko: 객관적으로 봤을 때 걔 주장은 전혀 이성적이지 않았어.

en: The visitor sat across from me.
Guests arrived by twos and threes.
The guests are all gone.
The customer did not come.
Customers stopped coming to our shop.
The number of guests is 20.
You should prepare a room for the visitor.
I saw some of the guests leave the banquet room.
ko: 몇몇 손님들이 연회장에서 나가는 걸 봤어.

en: She was pleased to be treated as a guest.
ko: 걔는 손님 대접 받는 걸 좋아했어.

en: The visitors were greeted with warm handshakes.
When the visitor entered the room, we stood to greet him.
ko: 손님이 들어왔을 때 우리는 모두 일어서서 맞이했어.

en: I've lost my filling.
This tooth has to have a filling.
As I entered the café, I found two young men watching a wrestling match on television.
ko: 카페에 들어가니까 젊은 남자 둘이서 TV로 레슬링 경기를 보고 있더라고.

en: As I entered a tearoom, I found two young men watching a wrestling match on television.
ko: 찻집에 들어가니까 젊은 남자 둘이서 TV로 레슬링 경기를 보고 있더라.

en: I asked for a seat in the smoking section.
Smoking, please.
Smoking or non-smoking?
Is there a place I can smoke?
ko: 담배 피울 수 있는 곳 있어?

en: Could we have a table in the smoking section?
Smokers are far more likely to develop lung cancer than non-smokers are.
ko: 흡연자가 비흡연자보다 폐암에 걸릴 확률이 훨씬 높아.

en: If people who smoke are deprived of their cigarettes, they get nervous and irritable.
ko: 흡연자들은 담배 못 피우게 하면 불안해하고 짜증 내.

en: Smokers take twice as many days off sick as non-smokers.
ko: 흡연자는 비흡연자보다 병가 내는 날이 두 배나 많아.

en: Being in a room full of smokers is my pet peeve.
ko: 담배 피우는 사람들로 가득 찬 방에 있는 건 정말 질색이야.

en: I gave up smoking and I feel like a new man.
ko: 담배 끊었더니 몸이 완전 새사람 된 것 같아.

en: The doctor told me to give up smoking.
Please refrain from smoking.
Smoking will do more harm than good.
You must give up smoking, as it is unhealthy.
ko: 건강에 안 좋으니까 담배 꼭 끊어야 해.

en: Smoking may be harmful to his heart.
ko: 흡연이 걔 심장에 안 좋을 수도 있어.

en: Smoking has an ill effect upon health.
It is said that smoking is bad for your health.
Smoking is strictly prohibited.
Smoking means suicide.
Smoking is now banned on all domestic plane flights.
ko: 이제 모든 국내선 비행기에서 흡연이 금지됐어.

en: Smoking is harmful to health.
Smoking affects your health.
Smoking affects our health.
Don't forget the fact that smoking is bad for your health.
ko: 담배 피우는 게 건강에 안 좋다는 거 잊지 마.

en: Smoking is bad for the health.
Smoking is a danger to your health.
Smoking will do you a lot of harm.
Smoking has a great deal to do with cancer.
It's foolish to think that smoking has little to do with cancer.
ko: 담배가 암이랑 별 상관없다고 생각하는 건 진짜 바보 같은 짓이야.

en: Smoking does damage your lungs.
Smoking does you more harm than good.
ko: 담배는 몸에 득보다 실이 훨씬 많아.

en: Smoking is bad for you.
The habit of smoking is very difficult to get rid of.
ko: 담배 끊는 습관은 버리기가 진짜 힘들어.

en: I wish I could break the habit of smoking.
Smokers are as aware as anybody else of the disadvantages of their hobby, but manage to live with that knowledge for two main reasons.
ko: 흡연자들도 담배가 몸에 안 좋다는 건 누구보다 잘 알지만, 크게 두 가지 이유 때문에 그냥 피우는 거야.

en: Some people find it easier to grasp the short-term effects of smoking.
ko: 어떤 사람들은 담배의 단기적인 효과를 더 쉽게 체감해.

en: Short-term effects of smoking include unfitness, wheezing, a general vulnerability to illness, bad breath, bad skin and so on.
ko: 담배를 피우면 나타나는 단기적인 증상으로는 숨이 차고, 쌕쌕거리고, 쉽게 아프고, 입 냄새, 피부 노화 같은 게 있어.

en: Most people killed by smoking were not heavy smokers.
ko: 담배 때문에 죽는 사람들 대부분이 골초는 아니었대.

en: Is there a link between smoking and lung cancer?
ko: 흡연이랑 폐암 사이에 진짜 연관성이 있을까?

en: There is no denying the fact that smoking is harmful.
ko: 담배가 해롭다는 건 부정할 수 없는 사실이야.

en: Smoking has affected his lungs.
ko: 담배 때문에 그 사람 폐가 안 좋아졌어.

en: Smoking is responsible for many cases of lung cancer.
ko: 폐암 환자들 보면 담배가 원인인 경우가 진짜 많아.

en: It is a fact that smoking is bad for health.
ko: 담배가 건강에 안 좋다는 건 팩트지.

en: It is a fact that smoking is a danger to health.
We have absolute proof that smoking is bad for your health.
ko: 담배가 몸에 해롭다는 확실한 증거가 있어.

en: Smoking or health, the choice is yours.
Yoshio helped me lift the box up.
Yoshino is a place famous for its cherry blossoms.
Mr Yoshimoto taught us many trivial matters.
ko: 요시모토 선생님이 우리한테 별거 아닌 잡다한 것들을 많이 가르쳐 주셨어.

en: Mr Yoshida directed me to come at once.
ko: 요시다 씨가 나보고 당장 오라고 하더라고.

en: Mr Yoshida never breaks his promise.
ko: 요시다 씨는 약속을 어기는 법이 없어.

en: Mr Yoshida is at home in French history.
ko: 요시다 씨는 프랑스 역사에 대해서는 정말 잘 알아.

en: Mr Yoshida is too severe with his children.
Take your time, Yoshida.
Hello, I have a reservation, my name is Kaori Yoshikawa. Here is the confirmation card.
ko: 안녕하세요, 예약했는데요. 제 이름은 요시카와 카오리예요. 여기 확인증요.

en: Chrysanthemums smell sweet.
Let's carry on the discussion.
He is second to none when it comes to debating.
ko: 토론하는 거 보면 걔 따라올 사람 없어.

en: The discussion was heated.
Discussion is based upon mutual respect.
The argument ended in a fight.
All the arguments pointed in the same direction.
ko: 모든 주장이 다 한 방향을 가리키고 있었어.

en: My argument is indebted in a number of places to the aesthetic theories of Adorno, Horkheimer and others.
ko: 내 주장은 아도르노나 호르크하이머 같은 사람들의 미학 이론에서 빌려온 부분이 많아.

en: The essential points of my argument have been expressed in the preceding pages.
ko: 내 주장의 핵심은 앞부분에서 이미 다 말했어.

en: The bell went off right in the middle of our discussion.
ko: 우리가 한창 토론하고 있는데 딱 벨이 울리더라.

en: Let's not argue for the sake of arguing.
Imagine, for the sake of argument, a tribal group in which mother-son incest was countenanced.
ko: 논의를 위해 가령 엄마와 아들 사이의 근친상간이 허용되는 부족이 있다고 가정해 보자.

en: No one could get the better of him in an argument.
ko: 말싸움으로 걔를 이길 수 있는 사람은 아무도 없어.

en: Women will have the last word.
ko: 결국 여자가 마지막에 이기게 되어 있어.

en: It is hardly worth discussing.
After they argued, they didn't speak to each other for a week.
ko: 걔네 싸우고 나서 일주일 동안 서로 말도 안 했대.

en: The discussion produced a great deal of noise, but no forward motion.
ko: 토론은 요란하기만 했지, 정작 진전된 건 하나도 없었어.

en: The chairman rejected his absurd proposal.
ko: 의장이 그 사람의 말도 안 되는 제안을 거절했어.

en: The chairman resigned out of the blue.
The chairperson ordered silence.
The chairman should take the minority opinion into account.
The chairman would only make her comments off the record.
The chairman suggested that we should discuss the problem.
The chairman put forward an important plan at the meeting.
The chairman did not rule out the possibility of a disagreement.
ko: 의장님은 의견 차이가 생길 가능성을 배제하지 않았어요.

en: The chairman called the committee to order.
The chairman rejected the proposal.
The chairperson has been associated with the organization for ten years.
ko: 의장님은 그 단체와 10년 동안 함께 일해 왔어요.

en: She attended the meeting at the request of the chairman.
I would like to nominate Don Jones as chairman.
ko: 돈 존스 씨를 의장으로 추천하고 싶어요.

en: The brunt of criticism was borne by the chairmen.
The chairperson cut me short.
Suppose we change the subject.
Let's proceed with the items on the agenda.
I apologize for the delay in sending the agenda.
The bill was eviscerated before being passed by the legislature.
ko: 그 법안은 입법부를 통과하기 전에 핵심 내용이 다 빠져버렸어요.

en: It's a sop to Congress.
Congress went into recess.
Parliament has been dissolved.
Parliament has its beginnings in 14th-century England.
Do you know when the first parliament came into being?
The bill was passed by an overwhelming majority.
The chances are that the bill will be rejected.
The bill passed by a small majority of 10 votes.
My sister-in-law had four children in five years.
ko: 우리 올케는 5년 동안 아이를 넷이나 낳았어요.

en: It was just polite applause.
Try to fulfill your duty.
You are not to neglect your duty.
You must do your duty.
Yoshio said he would pay as much as 15000 yen for a new pair of basketball shoes, but I thought that was quite expensive.
ko: 요시오가 새 농구화에 15,000엔이나 낼 수 있다고 했지만, 전 그게 꽤 비싸다고 생각했어요.

en: My brother-in-law is ready to lose his temper at trifles.
ko: 우리 매형은 사소한 일에도 툭하면 화를 내요.

en: Faith which does not doubt is dead faith.
There's a blind man looking for a shadow of doubt.
There is no room for doubt.
One question was what I was going to be.
ko: 한 가지 질문은 내가 장래에 무엇이 될 것인가였어요.

en: The question is whether Mike knew the fact or not.
ko: 문제는 마이크가 그 사실을 알았느냐 아니냐예요.

en: It was not what he said, but the way he said it that made me suspicious.
ko: 그 사람 말 때문이 아니라, 말하는 방식 때문에 의심이 생겼어요.

en: One thing remains doubtful.
Without a doubt!
Suspicion is destructive of friendship.
There is little room for doubt.
I feel profound sympathy for the victims.
You cannot make omelets without breaking eggs.
ko: 계란을 깨지 않고는 오믈렛을 만들 수 없죠.

en: As to onomatopoetic expressions, we find interesting examples in Hopi.
ko: 의성어 표현에 대해서라면 호피어에서 재미있는 예들을 찾을 수 있어요.

en: Engineers are crazy about solar energy.
The engineer seeks not so much to know nature as to make use of it.
ko: 그 엔지니어는 자연을 알기보다는 이용하는 데 관심이 있어요.

en: The shortage of engineers is the greatest bottleneck to the development of our company.
ko: 엔지니어 부족이 우리 회사 성장의 가장 큰 걸림돌이에요.

en: Technological innovation brought about the rapid progress of the information industry.
ko: 기술 혁신이 정보 산업의 급속한 발전을 가져왔어요.

en: Thanks to the technological innovation, the maximum output of the factory has doubled.
ko: 기술 혁신 덕분에 공장의 최대 생산량이 두 배로 늘었어요.

en: The engineer climbed the telephone pole.
The engineer demonstrated how to operate the sophisticated system.
ko: 엔지니어가 복잡한 시스템 작동법을 시연해 보였어요.

en: The ceremony began with his speech.
What is the difference between imitation and real diamonds?
